quotes.text: Few people know how to take a walk. The qualifications are endurance, plain clothes, old shoes, an eye for nature, good humor, vast curiosity, good speech, good silence and nothing too much.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: If we could give every individual the right amount of nourishment and exercise, not too little and not too much, we would have found the safest way to health.
quotes.author: Hippocrates

quotes.text: It is a shame for a man to grow old without seeing the beauty and strength of which his body is capable.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: Movement is a medicine for creating change in a person's physical, emotional, and mental states.
quotes.author: Carol Welch

quotes.text: Exercise and temperance can preserve something of our early strength even in old age.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.text: Those who think they have not time for bodily exercise will sooner or later have to find time for illness.
quotes.author: Edward Stanley

quotes.text: Great effort is required to arrest decay and restore vigor. One must exercise proper deliberation, plan carefully before making a move, and be alert in guarding against relapse following a renaissance.
quotes.author: Horace

quotes.text: Lack of activity destroys the good condition of every human being, while movement and methodical physical exercise save it and preserve it.
quotes.author: Plato
